marketNews.title: Labor Confederation VP on Proposed UMP 2025 Variables
marketNews.content: Vice President of the Indonesian Workers Union Confederation, Kahar S. Cahyono, said the Ministry of Manpower proposed an alpha variable for labor‑intensive industries in the range 0.2‑0.5 and for capital‑intensive industries around 0.2‑0.8 in the new formula for provincial minimum wage (UMP) 2025. The government proposal is lower than the Confederation's demand for alpha around 1‑1.2 to maintain purchasing power in 2025. Alpha is an index representing labor contribution to regional economic growth. In the 2024 UMP formula, alpha was set around 0.1‑0.3.

marketNews.title: MSCI Announces Index Review Effective 26 Nov 2024 – 27 Feb 2025
marketNews.content: MSCI announced the review of its Global Standard Index, Small Cap Index, and Micro Cap Index, effective 26 November 2024 to 27 February 2025. Details: MSCI Indonesia Global Standard – No entries or exits. MSCI Indonesia Small Cap – Entry: AVIA; Exits: BTPS, SCMA. MSCI Indonesia Micro Cap – No entries or exits.

marketNews.title: Economy Minister Optimistic on Indonesia Palm Oil Production Increase
marketNews.content: Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, said he is confident Indonesia's crude palm oil (CPO) production can be increased in coming years to meet higher demand from an increased biodiesel blend. The government plans to raise the biodiesel blend from 35% (B35) to 40% (B40) in 2025. According to the Indonesian Biofuel Producers Association, B40 will require 13.9 million tons of CPO per year, up from 11 million tons for B35. To boost CPO production, the government encourages increased agricultural practices and a rejuvenation program for smallholder oil palm farms.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Reports Rise in Foreign Exchange Reserves to $151.2 Billion
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia reported that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves at the end of October 2024 increased to $151.2 billion (vs September 2024: $149.9 billion). The rise was driven by tax and service receipts and foreign borrowing. The reserve level equals financing of 6.6 months of imports or 6.4 months of imports plus external debt payments.

marketNews.title: Energy Ministry Plans 3 GW Geothermal Capacity by 2033
marketNews.content: Coordinator for Exploration and Exploitation of Geothermal Energy, Roni Chandra, said the government plans to develop geothermal energy up to 3 GW by 2033, adding 500 MW to the current capacity of 2.5 GW.

marketNews.title: Finance Minister to Exempt Aircraft Parts Import Duties from 1 Jan 2025
marketNews.content: Finance Minister Sri Mulyani will waive import duties on aircraft spare parts starting 1 January 2025 through Minister of Finance Regulation No. 81 of 2024. The measure aims to lower airline ticket prices.

marketNews.title: BPKP Reports 53% Inefficient Use of Local Government Budgets in 2023
marketNews.content: Head of the Financial and Development Supervision Agency, Muhammad Yusuf Ateh, said 53% of local government budgets in 2023 were inefficient, amounting to IDR 141 trillion. Inefficiency stems from inaccurate budgeting bases and lack of clear performance indicators, leading to reduced regional original revenue.

tickerNews.title: EXCL 9M24: Below Expectations, ARPU Trend Declines
tickerNews.content: XL Axiata (EXCL) recorded net profit of 292 billion rupiah (-16% YoY, -40% QoQ) in 3Q24. This makes net profit for 9M24 1.3 trillion rupiah (+32% YoY), below expectations as only 70% of FY24F consensus estimate. The decline in EXCL performance in 3Q24 is very weak, given consensus did not raise FY24F net profit expectations significantly and EXCL recorded performance exceeding consensus (57% of FY24F estimate) in 1H24. Operationally, EXCL operating profit in 3Q24 reached 1.3 trillion rupiah (+11% YoY, -9% QoQ), so operating profit for 9M24 became 4.1 trillion rupiah (+26% YoY) and slightly above expectations at 76% of FY24F consensus estimate. Net profit decline in 3Q24 was pressured by other expenses rising sharply to 132 billion rupiah (vs 2Q24: 11 billion, 3Q23: 19 billion). Management explained increase came from one-off costs related to integration of fixed broadband business from Link Net (LINK) completed on 29 Sep 2024 about 100 billion rupiah. Additionally, JV loss in 3Q24 increased to 124 billion rupiah (vs 2Q24 loss 51 billion, 3Q23 loss 37 billion) caused by higher losses from LINK and Princeton Digital Group Data Center. Mobile subscriber count in 3Q24 slightly increased (+2% YoY, +0.2% QoQ), but ARPU fell significantly (-2% YoY, -7% QoQ) to 41,000 rupiah. ARPU decline aligns with industry trend: Telkom Indonesia (TLKM) ARPU 43.1k rupiah (-11% YoY, -4% QoQ) and Indosat (ISAT) ARPU 37.2k rupiah (+2% YoY, -3% QoQ). EXCL ARPU remains second largest in Indonesia in 3Q24. Management says ARPU decline due to weakening purchasing power and tighter competition as rivals sell cheaper packages. Also dual SIM usage increased, with users buying cheaper provider packages. Integration of LINK completed end of 3Q24, additional impact on net profit will be fully felt in 4Q24. Management cannot yet quantify additional profit from fixed broadband. They will develop fixed broadband via cross conversion strategy: selling XL mobile packages to First Media customers and First Media content packages to XL Home customers. Due diligence on merger with Smartfren Telecom (FREN) near completion; finalization depends on regulator approval. Key Takeaway: Need signs of bottoming in ARPU driven by price increases before positive stock trend. Investors should watch merger progress with FREN and additional income from LINK fixed broadband.

tickerNews.title: PTRO Plans Stock Split 1:10
tickerNews.content: Petrosea (PTRO) plans a stock split with a ratio of 1:10. The expected initial trading date with the new nominal on the regular market and negotiation is 30 December 2024. The plan will be discussed in the RUPSLB on 16 December 2024.

tickerNews.title: MIDI Guidance Upgrade
tickerNews.content: Management of Midi Utama Indonesia (MIDI), in an earnings call on Monday (4/11), upgraded FY24 same‑store sales growth (SSSG) guidance from +8% YoY to +9% YoY (vs 9M24 realization +10.11% YoY). This is the second time MIDI raises FY24 SSSG guidance, previously at +6% YoY earlier in the year. The upgrade follows strong growth outside Java, which management says is double‑digit. In addition to SSSG, management also revised FY24 revenue growth guidance from +13% YoY to +14% YoY, with net profit growth targeted higher than revenue growth.

tickerNews.title: PTPP New Contract Value
tickerNews.content: PT PP (PTPP) recorded new contract value of 24.3 trillion rupiah (-17% YoY) during 10M24, equal to 76% of the 2024 target of 32 trillion rupiah. The government contributed 41% of the total new contract value, followed by state‑owned enterprises (31%) and the private sector (28%).

tickerNews.title: PGEO Cancels Capex Plans
tickerNews.content: Pertamina Geothermal Energy (PGEO) CFO Yurizki Rio said the company cancelled capex of US$300 million (IDR 4.7 trillion) for inorganic expansion because two acquisition plans were abandoned. He did not detail the cancelled projects. Previously PGEO signed a non‑disclosure agreement with Turkish geothermal asset developer Kipas Holding and is rumored to plan acquisition of the Sorik Marapi geothermal power plant in North Sumatra owned by KS Orka Renewables Pte. Ltd.

tickerNews.title: KLBF Introduces New HFMD Vaccine
tickerNews.content: Kalbe Farma (KLBF), through its subsidiary PT Kalventis Sinergi Farma, introduced a new vaccine for hand, foot and mouth disease (HFMD), the HFMD EV71 vaccine. The vaccine is the result of a collaboration between KLBF and Sinovac Biotech. KLBF director Mulia Lie said the company is committed to increase local vaccine production over the next five years, aiming for domestic supply and export to international markets.

tickerNews.title: FAPA Increases Share Buyback Plan
tickerNews.content: FAP Agri (FAPA) plans to increase its share buyback program from a maximum of 180 million (5%) shares to a maximum of 292.2 million (8.05%) shares. The buyback fund allocation will rise from a maximum of IDR 900 billion to a maximum of IDR 1.5 trillion. This plan will be discussed in the RUPSLB on 13 December 2024. FAPA also announced that to date the company has executed a share buyback of 70.7 million shares using IDR 375.4 billion.

tickerNews.title: AALI Legal Issue Clarification
tickerNews.content: Astra Agro Lestari (AALI), in a clarification to IDX, stated that its subsidiary PT Rimbunan Alam Sentosa is undergoing legal proceedings by the Central Sulawesi High Prosecutor's Office over overlapping land of 1,329 hectares with PT Perkebunan Nusantara XIV. AALI said details cannot be disclosed as the case is still under investigation by authorities.

tickerNews.title: AVIA Added to MSCI Indonesia Small Cap Index
tickerNews.content: MSCI announced the review of its Global Standard Index, Small Cap Index, and Micro Cap Index, effective 26 November 2024 to 27 February 2025. In the MSCI Indonesia Small Cap Index, AVIA is added as a new constituent.

tickerNews.title: BTPS Removed from MSCI Indonesia Small Cap Index
tickerNews.content: MSCI announced the review of its Global Standard Index, Small Cap Index, and Micro Cap Index, effective 26 November 2024 to 27 February 2025. In the MSCI Indonesia Small Cap Index, BTPS is removed as a constituent.

tickerNews.title: SCMA Removed from MSCI Indonesia Small Cap Index
tickerNews.content: MSCI announced the review of its Global Standard Index, Small Cap Index, and Micro Cap Index, effective 26 November 2024 to 27 February 2025. In the MSCI Indonesia Small Cap Index, SCMA is removed as a constituent.
